title: James Benning - California Trilogy
description:
An Mp4 rip of Filmmuseum's DVD release of James Benning's California Trilogy.

The Trilogy includes:
El Valley Centro (2000, 87 mins) 
Los (2001, 87 mins)
Sogobi (2002, 87 mins)

===Info===
File Size.........: 4.96 GB
Resolution........: 720x540
Runtime...........: Exactly 87 mins each
Video Codec.......: x264
Video Format......: MPEG-4 VIDEO
Frame Rate........: 25
Genre.............: Landscape, Avant-Garde, Slow Cinema
IMDB .............: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2328813/



Produced at the junction of two millennia, the California Trilogy is James Benning's three-part topographical study of America's "Golden State". Looking to the past while investigating the present, the mathematician-turned-filmmaker condenses three distinct Californian landscapes into a total of 105 shots, each exactly 2Ã‚Â½ minutes long. Formal restraint and compositional precision combine with ambient sound and an unheard social commentary to create a hypnotic journey across the 31st US State; from the Great Central Valley (El Valley Centro) through greater Los Angeles (Los) to the Californian wilderness (Sogobi). This 2-disc set presents the complete California Trilogy for the first time ever on DVD.

=== Screens === 

===========================

It certainly isn't HD quality, but it's probably the best you're going to find anywhere outside of the actual film prints. The MP4's really don't differ much from the quality that can found on the European DVD. 

If you're looking to be entertained, these aren't the films for you. The trilogy is purely a quiet contemplation of American landscapes
